fr.zelus.jarvis.dialogflow

Class DialogFlowApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.zelus.jarvis.dialogflow.DialogFlowApi

  • public class DialogFlowApi
extends Object
    A wrapper of the DialogFlow API that provides utility methods to connect to a given DialogFlow project, start sessions, manage registered intents, and detect intents instances from textual inputs.

    This class is used to easily setup a connection to a given DialogFlow project. Note that in addition to the constructor parameters, the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable must be set and point to the DialogFlow project's key. See DialogFlow documentation for further information.

      • GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS_PATH_KEY

        public static String GOOGLE_CREDENTIALS_PATH_KEY
        The Configuration key to store the path of the JSON credential file for DialogFlow.

        If this key is not set the DialogFlowApi will use the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable to retrieve the credentials file.

        See Also:
        DialogFlowApi(JarvisCore, Configuration)

      • DEFAULT_LANGUAGE_CODE

        public static String DEFAULT_LANGUAGE_CODE
        The default language processed by DialogFlow.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DialogFlowApi

        public DialogFlowApi(JarvisCore jarvisCore,
                     Configuration configuration)
        Constructs a DialogFlowApi with the provided configuration.

        The provided configuration must provide values for the following keys:

        • jarvis.dialogflow.projectId: the unique identifier of the DialogFlow project
        The value jarvis.dialogflow.language is not mandatory: if no language code is provided in the Configuration the default one (DEFAULT_LANGUAGE_CODE will be used.

        The value jarvis.dialogflow.credentials.path is not mandatory either: if no credential path is provided in the Configuration the DialogFlowApi will use the GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS environment variable to retrieve the credentials file.

        Parameters:
        jarvisCore - the JarvisCore instance managing the DialogFlowApi
        configuration - the Configuration holding the DialogFlow project ID and language code
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided jarvisCore, configuration or one of the mandatory configuration value is null.
        DialogFlowException - if the client failed to start a new session

    • Method Detail

      • getProjectId

        public String getProjectId()
        Returns the DialogFlow project unique identifier.
        Returns:
        the DialogFlow project unique identifier

      • getLanguageCode

        public String getLanguageCode()
        Returns the code of the language processed by DialogFlow.
        Returns:
        the code of the language processed by DialogFlow

      • getRegisteredIntentsFullView

        protected List<com.google.cloud.dialogflow.v2.Intent> getRegisteredIntentsFullView()
        Returns the full descriptions of the Intents that are registered in the DialogFlow project.

        The full descriptions of the Intents include the training phrases, that are typically used in testing methods to check that a created Intent contains all the information provided to the API. To get a partial description of the registered Intents see getRegisteredIntents().

        Note: this method is protected for testing purposes, and should not be called by client code.

        Returns:
        the full descriptions of the Intents that are registered in the DialogFlow project
        Throws:
        DialogFlowException - if the DialogFlowApi is shutdown

      • getRegisteredIntents

        protected List<com.google.cloud.dialogflow.v2.Intent> getRegisteredIntents()
        Returns the partial description of the Intents that are registered in the DialogFlow project.

        The partial descriptions of the Intents does not include the training phrases. To get a full description of the registered Intents see getRegisteredIntentsFullView()

        Note: this method is protected for testing purposes, and should not be called by client code.

        Returns:
        the partial descriptions of the Intents that are registered in the DialogFlow project
        Throws:
        DialogFlowException - if the DialogFlowApi is shutdown

      • registerIntentDefinition

        public void registerIntentDefinition(IntentDefinition intentDefinition)
        Registers the provided intentDefinition in the DialogFlow project.

        This method reuses the information contained in the provided IntentDefinition to create a new DialogFlow Intent and add it to the current project.

        Note: this method does not train the underlying DialogFlow Machine Learning Engine, so multiple calls to this method are not generating multiple training calls. Once all the IntentDefinitions have been registered to the DialogFlow project use trainMLEngine() to train the ML Engine.

        Parameters:
        intentDefinition - the IntentDefinition to register to the DialogFlow project
        Throws:
        DialogFlowException - if the DialogFlowApi is shutdown, or if the Intent already exists in the DialogFlow project
        See Also:
        trainMLEngine()

      • createTrainingPhrase

        protected com.google.cloud.dialogflow.v2.Intent.TrainingPhrase createTrainingPhrase(String trainingSentence,
                                                                                    List<Context> outContexts)

      • createInContextNames

        protected List<com.google.cloud.dialogflow.v2.Intent.Parameter> createParameters(List<Context> contexts)

      • deleteIntentDefinition

        public void deleteIntentDefinition(IntentDefinition intentDefinition)
        Deletes the Intent matching the provided intentDefinition from the DialogFlow project.

        Note: this method does not train the underlying DialogFlow Machine Learning Engine, so multiple calls to this method are not generating multiple training calls. Once all the IntentDefinitions have been deleted from the DialogFlow project use trainMLEngine() to train the ML Engine.

        Parameters:
        intentDefinition - the IntentDefinition to delete from the DialogFlow project
        Throws:
        DialogFlowException - if the DialogFlowApi is shutdown
        See Also:
        trainMLEngine()

      • trainMLEngine

        public void trainMLEngine()
        Sends a training query to the DialogFlow ML Engine and waits for its completion.

        This method checks every second whether the underlying ML Engine has finished its training. Note that this method is blocking as long as the ML Engine training is not terminated, and may not terminate if an issue occurred on the DialogFlow side.

        Throws:
        DialogFlowException - if the DialogFlowApi is shutdown

      • createSession

        public JarvisSession createSession(String sessionId)
        Creates a new JarvisSession for the provided userId.

        The created session wraps the internal DialogFlow session that is used on the DialogFlow project to retrieve conversation parts from a given user.

        The returned JarvisSession is configured by the global Configuration provided in DialogFlowApi(JarvisCore, Configuration).

        Parameters:
        sessionId - the identifier to create a session for
        Returns:
        a new JarvisSession for the provided userId
        Throws:
        DialogFlowException - if the DialogFlowApi is shutdown

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shuts down the DialogFlow clients and invalidates the session.

        Note: calling this method invalidates the DialogFlow connection, and thus this class cannot be used to access DialogFlow API anymore.

      • isShutdown

        public boolean isShutdown()
        Returns whether the DialogFlow client is shutdown.
        Returns:
        true if the DialogFlow client is shutdown, false otherwise

      • getIntent

        public RecognizedIntent getIntent(String text,
                                  JarvisSession session)
        Returns the RecognizedIntent extracted from the provided text

        The returned RecognizedIntent is constructed from the raw Intent returned by the DialogFlow API, using the mapping defined in convertDialogFlowIntentToRecognizedIntent(QueryResult). RecognizedIntents are used to wrap the Intents returned by the Intent Recognition APIs and decouple the application from the concrete API used.

        This method uses the provided session to extract contextual Intents, such as follow-up or context-based Intents.

        Parameters:
        text - a String representing the textual input to process and extract the Intent from
        session - the JarvisSession wrapping the underlying DialogFlow session
        Returns:
        a RecognizedIntent extracted from the provided input text
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the provided text or session is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided text is empty
        DialogFlowException - if the DialogFlowApi is shutdown or if an exception is thrown by the underlying DialogFlow engine

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
        Closes the DialogFlow session if it is not shutdown yet.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class Object
